message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

This paper is about a novel copying framework for sequence-to-sequence based neural network models for text generation tasks. The paper specifically mentions abstractive sentence summarization and question generation tasks, which are both related to natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses pointer networks, which are a type of neural network architecture commonly used in machine learning and deep learning, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new framework, indicating that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another possible sub-category. The paper also involves training and optimization of neural networks, which falls under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper deals with text generation and summarization, which is related to information retrieval, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) a possible sub-category as well.
